intro: Chrysosplenium discolor var. shiobarense, commonly known as the Shiobarenese chrysosplenium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Saxifragaceae. It is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pink. The plant has elliptical to ovate leaves that are usually covered in a fine, hairy texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in mountainous regions of East Asia. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
